titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the In Transit exhibit photograph collection V1974.033
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T12:01-0500

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Historical Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The In Transit exhibit photograph collection consists of four photographs dating from 1887 to 1916. The photographs were part of the Brooklyn Historical Society's In Transit exhibit during the Fall of 1985. Images in this collection show a railroad car from the Brooklyn and Brighton Beach Railroad Company as well as elevated railroad tracks and streetcars in Downtown Brooklyn.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright will remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. All items in this collection will enter the public domain by 2036. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); In Transit exhibit photograph collection, V1974.033, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
